author: Peter Plagens
title: ‘Odyssey: Jack Whitten Sculpture’ Review: Biography at the Forefront
text:
Baltimore
Jack Whitten was a deservedly prominent American abstract painter who worked mostly in New York but spent a good part of each year on the island of Crete, where he turned to sculpture. Mr. Whitten (1939-2018) died just months before “Odyssey: Jack Whitten Sculpture” began its current run at the Baltimore Museum of Art. (It travels to New York’s Metropolitan Museum of Art in September.) Because almost none of the work has been shown publicly before, the exhibition, astutely curated by Katy Siegel, a professor of...
